file_content.text: You are ready.
Commander, what's wrong?
The visions are getting stronger. Either I ate something bad--or my bond with Valkorion's growing deeper by the minute.
More visions from Valkorion.
I had another nightmare. I was about to take the throne, but Vaylin was there... waiting for me.
I saw the throne...
She's gone now. It's her father we should worry about.
Whatever he pulls, I'll be ready. Did you bring the holocron?
I'm fine. Did you bring the holocron?
It's nothing.
I've been studying it since we escaped Nathema.
The relic's function remains a mystery, but its power is undeniable. If it can protect you from Valkorion...
Do you actually believe that dusty trinket can harm me?
This "trinket" is strong in the Force. You locked it away for a reason, and if you turn against me, I will use it.
I know it can.
Cling to antiques if you must, but do not lose focus.
I'm not one for Sith relics, but if it makes you squirm, it's good enough for me.
I'm counting on it.
You distract yourself with powers beyond your comprehension.
Keep playing nice, and we won't have to find out.
Don't force me to try.
I have no reason to betray you.
I think it scares you for a reason.
You're afraid.
My only fear is that you will lose sight of our goal.
Seek the Eternal Throne. We have sacrificed too much to turn on each other now.
I... I felt his presence. How can you stand it?
The more Valkorion talks, the more he reveals himself.
His rants are useful.
It's what he keeps hidden that scares me.
Valkorion and I have an arrangement. He rambles like a blowhard. I shower him with insults.
I enjoy taunting him.
I'm sure he loves that.
I'd plug my ears, but Valkorion would still find a way to rant and rave.
He's insufferable.
We'll rid you of him soon enough.
Commander, you're needed on the bridge.
Commander to the bridge.
Your crew's ready. It's time.
I once hosted a menagerie of spirits in my head. Valkorion is similar, if more vocal.
I'm used to Force ghosts.
I have a menagerie of spirits locked away in my mind. Valkorion is merely the most vocal.
I enjoy collecting ghosts.
Your mental defenses are truly impressive.
He may be toying with you, or perhaps you glimpsed something he didn't want you to see.
Valkorion's not the first person to hijack my mind, though he's certainly more talkative than Watcher X.
He's not the first.
I read the report. It's why I dissolved all brainwashing programs in Sith Intelligence.
Be careful Valkorion doesn't push you past your breaking point.
